result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin E. WASMER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt PTC Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • PTC Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court finds that defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed by expungment of record pursuant to Section 973.015 of the Wisconsin Statutes upon successful completion of sentence.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Have no contact with Leif Hagen.

records.addlTxt:
Count 3 - PTC Credit Card Fraud - No contest plea.   
Count 4 - PTC Theft - No contest plea.   Convicted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 03-03-16 at 10:30 a.m.  State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 2.   Motion granted.   Defendant must submit DNA sample.   Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.
Offer letter from ADA Prost to defense counsel.

$500.00 cash bail furnished at the time of arrest.
$500.00 cash bail and bail bond delivered to the Clerk of Court Office on 01-21-2016.
Plea Date set for 02-12-2016 at 9:30 a.m., Br. 1.
CASH BAIL TO BE SET AT $500.00 WHEN DEFENDANT HAS BAIL HEARING.

Defendant failed to appear for status conference.   Bench warrant authorized.   
Minutes.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-17-15 at 9:30 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Demand and Motion for Discovery & Inspection.   
Cover Letter.

Defendnat demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 08-17-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant is to have no contact with Katelyn Strauss.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.
RE:  Katelyun Strauss, on 05-27-15 at 2:30 p.m.
